name: CTET (Central Teacher Eligibility Test)
description: A national-level eligibility test conducted by the CBSE to determine a candidate's eligibility for appointment as a teacher for classes I to VIII in Central Government schools like KVS, NVS, etc. It is a qualifying exam and does not guarantee a job.

eligibility.ageLimit: Minimum 18 years, no upper age limit.
eligibility.educationalQualification: Varies for Paper I (Classes I-V) and Paper II (Classes VI-VIII). Generally requires Senior Secondary + D.El.Ed for Paper I, and Graduation + B.Ed/D.El.Ed for Paper II. Specifics are detailed in the official NCTE guidelines and the CTET information bulletin.

timeline.examDate: July 7, 2024 (for July 2024 session). The exam is held twice a year, typically in July and December.
timeline.resultDate: Typically announced within 4-6 weeks after the exam.

stages.name: Paper I (for Classes I-V)
stages.description: Duration: 2.5 hours. Contains 150 Multiple Choice Questions (MCQs) from five sections: Child Development & Pedagogy, Language I, Language II, Mathematics, and Environmental Studies. Each section has 30 questions.

stages.name: Paper II (for Classes VI-VIII)
stages.description: Duration: 2.5 hours. Contains 150 MCQs. Sections on Child Development & Pedagogy, Language I, and Language II are compulsory. Candidates must choose between (a) Mathematics and Science or (b) Social Studies/Social Science for the fourth section (60 questions).

examPattern.markingScheme: 1 mark is awarded for every correct answer. There is no negative marking for incorrect answers or unattempted questions. Total marks for each paper is 150.

syllabus.name: Language I & II (Paper I & II)
topics: Reading unseen passages (prose or drama and one poem)

syllabus.name: Social Studies/Social Science (Paper II)
topics: Pedagogical issues related to Social Science
